project.teaser: EdgeAI is as a key initiative for the European digital transition towards intelligent processing solutions at the edge.EdgeAI will develop new electronic components and systems, processing architectures, connectivity, software, algorithms, and middleware through the...
project.objective: EdgeAI is as a key initiative for the European digital transition towards intelligent processing solutions at the edge. EdgeAI will develop new electronic components and systems, processing architectures, connectivity, software, algorithms, and middleware through the combination of microelectronics, AI, embedded systems, and edge computing. EdgeAI will ensure that Europe has the necessary tools, skills, and technologies to enable edge AI as a viable alternative deployment option to legacy centralised solutions, unlocking the potential of ubiquitous AI deployment, with the long-term objective of Europe taking the lead of Intelligent Edge. EdgeAI will contribute to the Green Deal twin transition with a systemic, cross-sectoral approach, and will deliver enhanced AI-based electronic components and systems, edge processing platforms, AI frameworks and middleware. It will develop methodologies to ease, advance and tailor the design of edge AI technologies by co-ordinating efforts across 48 of the brightest and best R&D organizations across Europe. It will demonstrate the applicability of the developed approaches across a variety of vertical solutions, considering security, trust, and energy efficiency demands inherent in each of these use cases. EdgeAI will significantly contribute to the grand societal challenge to increase the intelligent processing capabilities at the edge.
project.title: Edge AI Technologies for Optimised Performance Embedded Processing
project.keywords: Edge processing, Artificial Intelligence, hardware architectures, neuromorphic, middleware

article.title: Helping Europe transition to an era of intelligent processing solutions

category.title: Project description
category.description: Article: description of linked project written by editorial team

programme.title: HORIZON-KDT-JU-2021-2-RIA-Focus Topic 1-Processing solutions for AI at the edge addressing the design stack and middleware

category.title: Topic
category.description: Programme: Part of the Commission work programme implementing legal basis

result.title: Report on strategies for edge AI HW/SW verification and integration of enabling technologies
result.description: The report covers the definition of strategies for edge AI HW/SW verification and common integration principles of enabling technologies into applications. These strategies will be applied during the verification and integration implementation in the various industries in D5.2-D5.6.

result.title: Report on conceptual framework for edge AI requirements and specification
result.description: The report covers the results for defining a conceptual framework for defining requirements, other common aspects (terminology, relevant standards, etc.), and trends in edge AI research and innovation. It serves as a blueprint for applying these concepts in the various industries in D1.2-D1.6.

result.title: Initial standardization plan
result.description: The deliverable is dedicated to the detailed description and presentation of the EdgeAI activities towards the standardization activities.

result.title: Project Handbook and Quality Assurance
result.description: The report covers the guidelines and rules related to the coordination and management of the project.

result.title: Intermediate Project Report 1
result.description: The report describes project progress during the period m01-m07.

result.title: Dissemination activities report RP2
result.description: The deliverable is dedicated to the detailed description, presentation and reporting of the Edge AI dissemination and communication activities during m14 – m25.

result.title: Plan for dissemination and exploitation including communication activities
result.description: The report covers the dissemination, communication and exploitation plan that will be followed by the EdgeAI consortium to realize all relevant activities.

result.title: Report on agri-food and beverage industry requirements and specification for edge AI
result.description: The report covers the implementation of the proposed requirements framework (D1.1) for the demonstrators in the agri-food and beverage industry value chain. It comprises (non-) functional requirements, terminology, and relevant standards.

result.title: Risk Management Plan
result.description: The report covers the risk management plan identifying sources of risks, evaluating the probability and severity and controlling risks by implementing mitigation measures so no unwanted effects incur on project’s development and sustainability.

result.title: Initial Data Management Plan
result.description: The report covers the DMP that describes how the project data/research outputs are findable, accessible, interoperable, and reusable (FAIR). The document will be revised towards the end of a project’s lifetime.

result.title: Report on mobility industry requirements and specification for edge AI
result.description: The report covers the implementation of the proposed requirements framework (D1.1) for the demonstrators in the mobility industry value chain. It comprises (non-) functional requirements, terminology, and relevant standards.

result.title: Intermediate Project Report 2
result.description: The report describes project progress during the period m14-m20.

result.title: First Updated Data Management Plan
result.description: The report covers the first revised DMP that describes how the project data/research outputs are implement according to FAIR principles.

result.title: Network building and AI KDT JU community engagement workshop
result.description: This deliverable will describe in detail the activities carried out towards the project networking, and the organization of the AI related KDT JU community engagement workshop.

result.title: Public communication: social media, website
result.description: The report covers the design, deploy, development and release of the project user-friendly and interactive portal as well as the release of project social media (LinkedIn, Twitter, and YouTube Channel).

result.title: Report on digital society requirements and specification for edge AI
result.description: The report covers the implementation of the proposed requirements framework (D1.1) for the demonstrators in the digital society value chain. It comprises (non-) functional requirements, terminology, and relevant standards.

result.title: Dissemination activities report RP1
result.description: The deliverable is dedicated to the detailed description, presentation and reporting of the Edge AI dissemination and communication activities during m01 – m13.

result.title: Report on road-mapping for cross-industrial domains edge AI requirements and specification
result.description: The report covers a conclusion of cross-industrial requirements engineering in the area of edge AI. It presents a compiled analysis of communalities and provides a general roadmap for AI technologies at the edge during the project and open issues beyond the project lifetime.

result.title: Report on digital industry requirements and specification for edge AI
result.description: The report covers the implementation of the proposed requirements framework (D1.1) for the demonstrators in the digital industry value chain. It comprises (non-) functional requirements, terminology, and relevant standards.

result.title: TD-Magic: From Pictures of Timing Diagrams To Formal Specifications

details.authors: Jie He, Dejan Nickovic, Ezio Bartocci, Radu Grosu

result.title: Report on energy industry requirements and specification for edge AI
result.description: The report covers the implementation of the proposed requirements framework (D1.1) for the demonstrators in the energy industry value chain. It comprises (non-) functional requirements, terminology, and relevant standards.

category.title: Report Summary

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

category.title: HORIZON JU Research and Innovation Actions
category.description: HORIZON JU Research and Innovation Actions
